blog.name: aremixoficeandfire
blog.title: Incorrect Westeros quotes
blog.description: An incoreect quotes blog for any and all Westerosi canon and semi canon. Primarily based on the books, but show, video game, comics, and RPG canons are all acceptable. Please include your source and which canon the quote should be tagged for.

summary:
Jon: Has anything ever gone right for the Starks?
Bran: As in ever?
Jon: Yeah.
*pause*
Sansa: I think Robb ordered a pizza...
body:
Jon: Has anything ever gone right for the Starks?
Bran: As in ever?
Jon: Yeah.
*pause*
Sansa: I think Robb ordered a pizza once.
Arya: The delivery guy burst into flames on the way here.

dialogue.name: Jon
dialogue.label: Jon:
dialogue.phrase: Has anything ever gone right for the Starks?

dialogue.name: Sansa
dialogue.label: Sansa:
dialogue.phrase: I think Robb ordered a pizza once.

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: The delivery guy burst into flames on the way here.

blog.title: Rina from Shire
blog.description: Russia| 18 y.o.| she/her. I'm hobbyst artist. A fan of Tolkien, Pratchett, Star Wars, Marvel and games.

summary:
Fantasy AU
Sorry for my English :0
Brandon Stark, who was once an common child, after his fall became disabled, once got to the...
body:
Fantasy AU

Sorry for my English :0

Brandon Stark, who was once an common child, after his fall became disabled, once got to the visionary magician who knew everything about the past and knew how to heal. After learning from him, Bran gained the same strength and regained health, learned to walk again. But these abilities left their mark on the young man. The old man was from the kind of werewolves, ravens, and Bran - a man, so from such an unusual merger of different entities in one turned out something beautiful: Bran found wings. But, unfortunately, he cannot hide them (sometimes it is rather inconvenient: 3)

Thus a new Three-Eyed Raven appeared, knowing the past, able to move into animals and able to heal.

Oh yeah, he also flies :>

blog.name: devilsbastion
blog.title: I came from the sea
blog.description:
'Game of Thrones & a Parting Glass' lives here, don't ask why, but you can search by character or author if you wish. and sometimes i snap photos, write words, and paint pictures. and sometimes i realize it's all futile. <!-- Start of StatCounter Code for Tumblr -->

blog.name: starksistersftw
blog.title: the north remembers
blog.description:
f o w l e r

30. INFP. House Stark. Hufflepuff.
Game of Thrones addict. Pokemon Master. Disney fanatic. Still waiting on my Hogwarts letter. Just your basic fangirl from Florida who loves cooking, sunshine, golden retrievers, and the 90s. Go Jags/Gators/Braves.
It's 2019 and I still miss Robb Stark.

summary: Hi! I'm not on tumblr. Bran told Jaime he didn't tell anyone what he did so Jaime can help them in the fight but also said "how...
question: Hi! I'm not on tumblr. Bran told Jaime he didn't tell anyone what he did so Jaime can help them in the fight but also said "how do you know there's afterwards" but Jaime lived and Bran still didn't do anything. That means he meant some other fight, like the one in Kingslanding
answer: Thanks, nonnie! I had forgotten about that moment. I’m definitely still holding out hope for Jaime to be going to King’s Landing to kill Cersei but I’m also mentally preparing myself for the worst just in case. TV SHOWS LOVE TO DISAPPOINT ME AND BREAK MY HEART :( :( :(

reblog.comment: Thanks, nonnie! I had forgotten about that moment. I’m definitely still holding out hope for Jaime to be going to King’s Landing to kill Cersei but I’m also mentally preparing myself for the worst just in case. TV SHOWS LOVE TO DISAPPOINT ME AND BREAK MY HEART :( :( :(

We size up who's up, who's down, and who's treading water.

blog.name: aryathenightwolf
blog.title: The Night Wolf
blog.description: Blog dedicated to Game of Thrones and my favourite character from the show and the books, the amazing Arya Stark... Once every hundred years I post about other things too

tags: how anyone can think she is actually thinking about whats best for anyone but herself is mind blowing
betraying Jon and ignoring his wishes is unexcusable
summary: Sansa is not getting any consequences for putting Dany's life in danger in the next episodes, I'm calling it. She is D&D's...
question: Sansa is not getting any consequences for putting Dany's life in danger in the next episodes, I'm calling it. She is D&D's Creator's Pet. She will just get her pretty castle to keep scheming without any living soul questioning her decisions.
answer:
100% agreed. In the last few seasons Sansa has basically gotten a blank check to do whatever she wants and, no matter how many times she puts her own desires before her own family, no matter who she manipulates or how unjustified her behavious is, the writers don’t really make her deal with the consequences of her actions. She just keeps going, not changing at all because she has no motivation to change.

Jon shouldn’t have said she was right after she hid the army of the Vale before the BotB, the Vale lords should have demanded some actual proof of LF’s betrayals before they allowed him to be executed, someone should have told her how stupid it is to openly dismiss Daenerys when she comes to help. Missandei deserved a medal for pointing out that Dany and her armies were the only reason her precious North had a chance against the army of the dead.

Jon should find out Sansa betrayed his secret the very same day he told her and this time he should not forgive her. Sansa used his parentage to hurt the woman he loves right after she saved the North. After Sansa swore she would never tell anyone. Arya should find out and be as pissed as she was in season 7 when she thought Sansa would betray Jon, because that’s what she has done. Sadly Bran doesn’t have any  reactions anymore, but if he were still Bran and not the 3ER he would be upset with Sansa too.

She should lose the respect of the northen lords and the northeners for being an oathbreaker, for using Jon as pawn. She should lose the power she loves so much. 

But honestly I don’t think the show will go there. I think she will get one of the best endings, regardless of her actions.

blog.name: maybe-ill-just-sing-about-it
blog.title: "I'm learning how to people."
blog.description: Hello! I'm Julianne. I'm 23, bi, and a writer. This blog is a place for the many things I love and feel. Currently accepting applications for a new hyperfixation. I have posted a lot about Critical Role, Brooklyn 99, Game of Thrones, cats, and Grey's Anatomy to name a few. DFTBA! Icon was made by xhorass!

summary: Since I'd kinda like to see Brienne go after Jaime and since we have ourselves a Three-Eyed Raven who sees and knows everything,...
body:
Since I’d kinda like to see Brienne go after Jaime and since we have ourselves a Three-Eyed Raven who sees and knows everything, I have a pitch for 8x05:

Brienne, crying in the courtyard as Jaime rides away.

Bran, suddenly appearing from behind like the drama raven he is: We don’t get to choose who we love.

Brienne: ???

Bran: He didn’t destroy Riverrun. For you.

Brienne: …

Bran: He’s not going back to be with Cersei. He gave YOU his heart. It’s yours. It will always be yours.

Brienne: *dons her armor and charges off in the night after her noble idiot knight*

blog.name: fangirlsblogtolife
blog.title: Fangirl's Blog to Life
blog.description: Just an 21 year old Fangirl blogging about books, actors, musicians, and food. Location: Boston

title: Game of Thrones Prophecies
body:
There are three Game of Thrones Prophecies

1. The Prince that was Promised

Melisandre spoke the words of this prophecy:  “The Long Night is coming. Only the Prince Who Was Promised can bring the dawn. The Prince is destined to “lead the people against a darkness” with a flaming sword called Lightbringer. “There will come a day after a long summer when the stars bleed and the cold breath of darkness falls heavy on the world,” and “in this dread hour a warrior shall draw from the fire a burning sword. And that sword shall be Lightbringer, the Red Sword of Heroes, and he who clasps it shall be Azor Ahai come again, and the darkness shall flee before him.” 

Many think that Arya Stark fits this Prophecy, but I don’t think so. Arya Stark has her own purpose which is shutting Brown Eyes, Blue Eyes and Green Eyes. Plus when she killed the Night King it was a dagger and not a sword. Also the dagger wasn’t on fire. 

I think the Prince may either be Jaime Lannister or Jon Snow. Jaime Lannister is known as a king slayer and is technically a prince. I know he only has one hand but it could be him considering the next prophecy works with this one. 

2. Valonqar

Cersei Lannister was told this prophecy long ago on Season 5:  “You will never wed the prince, you will wed the king.” “You’ll be queen, for a time. Then comes another — younger, more beautiful — to cast you down and take all you hold dear…The king will have 20 children, and you will have three…Gold will be their crowns, gold their shrouds. And when your tears have drowned you, the valonqar shall wrap his hands about your pale white throat and choke the life from you.” 

So far most of this prophecy has been fulfilled. Cersei was promised to Jon’s Dad but married Robert Baratheon. She did have three children but with her brother. Robert did have many bastard sons. The prophecy does not state that they would have children together but separately.Her three children all did die awful deaths in the show. Cersei has been Queen for sometime now and there is someone currently more beautiful that is planning on taking the throne herself aka Daenerys, but it could be Sansa. Sansa does want to take everything away from her just like Cersei took almost everything from Sansa. The last part of the prophecy states that one of her ‘brothers” will kill her. I think it will be Jaime that will help Arya kill his sister and not Tyrion. Tywin Lannister told Tyrion that he is not his son. Meaning that Tyrion could very well be a Targaryen for all we know. Tyrions mother was well liked by the Mad King himself. Which brings me to the next prophecy. 

3. Three Heads of the Dragon

Rhaegar Targaryen has said that “The Dragon has three heads.” Meaning that there must be three dragon riders or Three Targaryens.

So we all now know that Jon Snow is Aegon Targaryen. Daenerys is a Targaryen. Now we need another one. This brings me back to the time that Tywin Lannister told Tyrion that he is not his son. The Mad King did ‘fancy’ Tyrion’s mother and maybe he is the child of the two. Which might be the reason that the dragons didn’t burn him to ash. Tyrion has said from the beginning that as a little boy he dreamt of dragons. I believe that he is a Targaryen. He is loyal to Jon and Daeneyrs. Which means that Tyrion would be Daeneyrs half brother and Uncle to Jon. Which could be part of the prophecy that states about the Dragon having three heads. Three Heads of House Targaryen. I firmly believe this. Jon is the rightful heir, Daenerys wants the throne, and Tyrion is Daenerys Hand. Three Dragons ruling the throne. 

What if Jon is the Prince that was Promised, Daenerys is the beautiful Queen that will de-throne Cersei, Jaime assisting Arya killing Cersei and Tyrion being the third dragon? At this point in the final season of Game of Thrones anything is possible. Plus I believe that if anyone would know about who Tyrions father is, it would be our three eyed raven, Bran Stark.

Then comes another — younger, more beautiful — to cast you down and take all you hold dear…The king will have 20 children, and you will have three…Gold will be their crowns, gold their shrouds. And when your tears have drowned you, the valonqar shall wrap his hands about your pale white throat and choke the life from you.” 

So far most of this prophecy has been fulfilled. Cersei was promised to Jon’s Dad but married Robert Baratheon. She did have three children but with her brother. Robert did have many bastard sons. The prophecy does not state that they would have children together but separately.Her three children all did die awful deaths in the show. Cersei has been Queen for sometime now and there is someone currently more beautiful that is planning on taking the throne herself aka Daenerys, but it could be Sansa. Sansa does want to take everything away from her just like Cersei took almost everything from Sansa. The last part of the prophecy states that one of her ‘brothers” will kill her. I think it will be Jaime that will help Arya kill his sister and not Tyrion. Tywin Lannister told Tyrion that he is not his son. Meaning that Tyrion could very well be a Targaryen for all we know. Tyrions mother was well liked by the Mad King himself. Which brings me to the next prophecy. 

3. Three Heads of the Dragon

Rhaegar Targaryen has said that “The Dragon has three heads.” Meaning that there must be three dragon riders or Three Targaryens.

So we all now know that Jon Snow is Aegon Targaryen. Daenerys is a Targaryen. Now we need another one. This brings me back to the time that Tywin Lannister told Tyrion that he is not his son. The Mad King did ‘fancy’ Tyrion’s mother and maybe he is the child of the two. Which might be the reason that the dragons didn’t burn him to ash. Tyrion has said from the beginning that as a little boy he dreamt of dragons. I believe that he is a Targaryen. He is loyal to Jon and Daeneyrs. Which means that Tyrion would be Daeneyrs half brother and Uncle to Jon. Which could be part of the prophecy that states about the Dragon having three heads. Three Heads of House Targaryen. I firmly believe this. Jon is the rightful heir, Daenerys wants the throne, and Tyrion is Daenerys Hand. Three Dragons ruling the throne. 

What if Jon is the Prince that was Promised, Daenerys is the beautiful Queen that will de-throne Cersei, Jaime assisting Arya killing Cersei and Tyrion being the third dragon? At this point in the final season of Game of Thrones anything is possible. Plus I believe that if anyone would know about who Tyrions father is, it would be our three eyed raven, Bran Stark.

summary: Also, I hate what game of thrones did to Bran. Now his entire arc seem utterly pointless. We spent 6 seasons watching him travel...
body:
Also, I hate what game of thrones did to Bran. Now his entire arc seem utterly pointless. We spent 6 seasons watching him travel north beyond the wall, lose and struggle so much on his journey to become the Tree Eyed Raven, being shown over and over that it was connected to the Night King and the White Walker storyline and in the end it amounted to … nothing.

We still don’t know why Bran was so important to the Night King, nor do we know what he even wanted in the first place; why was it so important for Bran to become what he became if in the end it didn’t really matter? Whatever in the hell was the point of connecting his entire arc to this part of the story if it was to turn around and have him simply sit there, doing nothing of use while Arya saves the day? Arya who never had any connection to this arc at all up until that point (and no that “blue eyes” line doesn’t fly).

Was Bran’s lone purpose to become a prop in order to dump infos that D&D were too lazy to bring up more organically? Because it seems like it was the only point of his character now.

Honestly, he can end up on the Iron Throne that his character will still be done dirty, because it is not what he’s been about up until now, it would be unearned, the one thing he spend his entire run on the show earning was pulled from under him for no good reason and I hate it.

summary:
Bran possessing Hodor was such a stroke of genius. Though Locke's murder probably didn't help his mental health any. 
Bran being...
body:
Bran possessing Hodor was such a stroke of genius. Though Locke’s murder probably didn’t help his mental health any.

Bran being feet away from Jon and choosing not to call him even though he desperately wants to is so heartbreaking. Especially when you think this is the last time Bran sees Jon as Bran.

summary: what are your thoughts on the jojenpaste theory and the frey pies theory
question: what are your thoughts on the jojenpaste theory and the frey pies theory
answer: The Jojen Reed is going to become weirwood paste for Bran to consume? Honestly I can see it as being true due to the repeated connections in the book between human sacrifice and magic but I’m really hoping it doesn’t come to pass. I like Jojen Reed and while it might be conceived as somewhat of a heroic sacrifice to help Bran come into his full power, it is undermined by the level of squick inherent in such a death. It’s a miserable way to go.

reblog.comment: The Jojen Reed is going to become weirwood paste for Bran to consume? Honestly I can see it as being true due to the repeated connections in the book between human sacrifice and magic but I’m really hoping it doesn’t come to pass. I like Jojen Reed and while it might be conceived as somewhat of a heroic sacrifice to help Bran come into his full power, it is undermined by the level of squick inherent in such a death. It’s a miserable way to go.

I like Jojen Reed and while it might be conceived as somewhat of a heroic sacrifice to help Bran come into his full power, it is undermined by the level of squick inherent in such a death. It’s a miserable way to go.

tags: i've had these ideas for a while
summary:
Ned Stark – The Ghost
Ned Stark, patriarch of the family until his death. He now haunts the Stark Manor and the forest they own....
body:
Got Magic AU – Part 1

Ned Stark – The Ghost

Ned Stark, patriarch of the family until his death. He now haunts the Stark Manor and the forest they own. Only his family members possessing magical powers/being supernatural beings can see him.

Catelyn Stark – The Undead

Catelyn Stark is the matriarch of the Stark family. She has been killed but is now an Undead. She looks like a living person thanks to a charm made by Sansa but her true appearance is the one of a corpse and she is mute due to her throat being slit. Catelyn cannot die again unless she is burnt or decapitated and thus is not afraid to put herself in danger for her family. Since she is a descendant of powerful witches, she is the reason her children and herself have powers.

Robb Stark – The War Spirit

Robb Stark is the first son of Ned and Catelyn. After his father’s murder, he becomes mad with grief and fury. He gets lost in the Northern Woods where he is found by War Spirits who make him one of their own to allow him to get his revenge. He is the most prone to violence in the family and can lash out easily. He is also over protective of his family. As a War Spirit, Robb can summon a full armour, a horse and a sword to slay his enemies.

Sansa Stark – The Witch

Sansa Stark is the second child of Ned and Catelyn. After her father’s death, her witch powers awaken. She is easily one of the most powerful members of the Stark and is behind Catelyn’s charm and Bran’s survival after he is attacked. She is the first to see her father’s ghost. Sansa’s powers includes the creation of charms, telekinesis and the creation of illusions. Blood and bones can make her magic stronger but she refuses to use them and she uses runes and crystals as vessels.

Arya Stark – The Vampire

After her father’s death, Arya Stark runs away from home and is found by Jaqen, a vampire who attacks her. She survives thanks to Robb’s intervention and her witch heritage and becomes a vampire. Stronger and faster than human, she is prone to mood swings for a while because of bloodlust but leans to control it. She wants to avenge her father and protect her family more than anything. Arya’s closest sibling was Jon and she is heartbroken when he joins the Order.

Bran Stark – The Druid

Bran Stark is the fourth child of Catelyn and Ned. His Druid powers allow him to control animals and to have visions. His powers awoke after his father’s death, just like Sansa’s, and they grew closer after. He is attacked by Jaime Lannister a few months later and is crippled as a result. This attack was the official beginning of the war between the Lannisters and the Starks.

Rickon Stark – The Werewolf

Last child of Ned and Catelyn, Rickon is a young boy who is turned into a werewolf after being attacked in the woods. He was following Robb, worried for his brother. His wolf form is huge and black, and is uncontrollable because it is the incarnation of Rickon’s pain and suffering.

Theon Greyjoy – The Kraken

Theon Greyjoy was placed in the Stark’s care when he was nine after his father was arrested for child abuse. Theon resented Ned for a while throughout his childhood because he was the judge who condemned his father and he is hesitant in joining the war. However, Jon’s betrayal makes him realize that he truly cares for the Starks and saves Rickon on his own. He is a water spirit, just like all the other member of his family and can manipulate water.

Jon Snow – The Hunter

Jon Snow is Ned Stark’s nephew who has been adopted by Ned and Catelyn after his birth due to his mother’s death. He distanced himself from his brothers’ and sisters’ after learning about his true parentage. After Ned’s death and the Starks becoming supernatural beings due to Catelyn’s heritage, he feels even more like an outcast. After one of Arya’s violent mood swings, the sibling of whom he was the closest, he becomes terrified and joins the Order, an organisation hunting supernatural beings, hoping to “cure” his family.
